title: Laptop Ran out of batteries in the middle of an update PLS HELP
body: I just had to completely reinstall League cause of some unrelated questions, and when the client was updating my Mac laptop ran out of batteries. When I turned it back on, it was stuck on 18 percent and still is 30 mins later. I really don't want to reinstall league again or anything, what should I do? How can I only start over the download of the client, or is there any other solution? Please respond if you can. Thanks

replies.body: What is stuck at 18 percent?  I don't see a situation here that would require a reinstall, but with some more details I can help!

The client update was stuck at 18 percent. Since it was suck so long, I restarted the client and it tried to install the client again, but this time it was stuck on 1 percent. Now, I am trying to repair league but it does not seem to be functioning well, just as it did on my previous post on the boards. ugghhhhhhhhh pls help meh

Thanks for the info!  There may be an admin issue that's preventing the client from being scanned.  Specifically go over the [admin settings](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues#mq9) in Mac Connection Issues guide to help.  Let me know if that works!

Thank you for the help,

what exactly am I supposed to do in "admin settings?" Also, I have rediscovered the problem that made me uninstall League in the first place. Everything seems top be disconnected. The whole chat part of the screen has a scrolling loading wheel, and the place where the play button is still says "0%."
